member.summary: Unspecified means the finish reason is unspecified.

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FinishReason.Safety
member.summary: Safety means the token generation was stopped as the response was flagged for safety reasons. NOTE: When streaming the Candidate.content will be empty if content filters blocked the output.

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FinishReason.Other
member.summary: Other means all other reasons that stopped the token generation

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FinishReason.Blocklist
member.summary: The token generation was stopped as the response was flagged for the terms which are included from the terminology blocklist.

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FinishReason.ProhibitedContent
member.summary: The token generation was stopped as the response was flagged for the prohibited contents.

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FinishReason.Spii
member.summary: The token generation was stopped as the response was flagged for Sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (SPII) contents.

member.summary: Unspecified function calling mode. This value should not be used.

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCallingMode.Auto
member.summary: Default model behavior, model decides to predict either a function call or a natural language response.

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCallingMode.Any
member.summary: Model is constrained to always predicting a function call only. If "allowed_function_names" are set, the predicted function call will be limited to any one of "allowed_function_names", else the predicted function call will be any one of the provided "function_declarations".

member.name: F:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCallingMode.None
member.summary: Model will not predict any function call. Model behavior is same as when not passing any function declarations.

member.summary: A Duration represents a signed, fixed-length span of time represented as a count of seconds and fractions of seconds at nanosecond resolution.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentRequest
member.summary: Request containing the for the model to embed.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentRequest.Model
member.summary: Required. The model's resource name. This serves as an ID for the Model to use. This name should match a model name returned by the `ListModels` method. Format: `models/{model}`

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentRequest.Content
member.summary: Required. The content to embed. Only the `parts.text` fields will be counted.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentRequest.TaskType
member.summary: Optional. Optional task type for which the embeddings will be used. Can only be set for `models/embedding-001`.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentRequest.Title
member.summary: Optional. An optional title for the text. Only applicable when TaskType is `RETRIEVAL_DOCUMENT`. Note: Specifying a `title` for `RETRIEVAL_DOCUMENT` provides better quality embeddings for retrieval.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentRequest.OutputDimensionality
member.summary: Optional. Optional reduced dimension for the output embedding. If set, excessive values in the output embedding are truncated from the end. Supported by newer models since 2024, and the earlier model (`models/embedding-001`) cannot specify this value.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentResponse
member.summary: The response to an EmbedContentRequest.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentResponse.Candidates
member.summary: Output only. Generated candidates.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentResponse.Embedding
member.summary: Output only. The embedding generated from the input content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EmbedContentResponse.Embeddings
member.summary: Output only. The embeddings for each request, in the same order as provided in the batch request.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Embedding
member.summary: A list of floats representing an embedding. Ref: https://ai.google.dev/api/rest/v1beta/Embedding

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Embedding.Value
member.summary: The embedding values.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileData
member.summary: URI based data.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileData.FileUri
member.summary: URI of the file of the image or video to include in the prompt.
member.remarks: The bucket that stores the file must be in the same Google Cloud project that's sending the request. You must also specify MIMETYPE. Size limit: 20MB

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileData.MimeType
member.summary: The IANA standard MIME type of the source data.
member.remarks: The media type of the image, PDF, or video specified in the data or fileUri fields. Acceptable values include the following: "image/png", "image/jpeg", "image/heic", "image/heif", "image/webp". application/pdf video/mov video/mpeg video/mp4 video/mpg video/avi video/wmv video/mpegps video/flv Maximum video length: 2 minutes. No limit on image resolution.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileRequest.DisplayName
member.summary: Optional. The human-readable display name for the File. The display name must be no more than 512 characters in length, including spaces. Example: "Welcome Image"

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileRequest.Name
member.summary: Optional. The resource name of the File to create.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource
member.summary: A file resource of the File API.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.Name
member.summary: Immutable. Identifier. The File resource name. The ID (name excluding the "files/" prefix) can contain up to 40 characters that are lowercase alphanumeric or dashes (-). The ID cannot start or end with a dash. If the name is empty on create, a unique name will be generated. Example: files/123-456

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.DisplayName
member.summary: Optional. The human-readable display name for the File. The display name must be no more than 512 characters in length, including spaces. Example: "Welcome Image"

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.MimeType
member.summary: Output only. MIME type of the file.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.SizeBytes
member.summary: Output only. Size of the file in bytes.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.CreateTime
member.summary: Output only. The timestamp of when the File was created. A timestamp in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, with nanosecond resolution and up to nine fractional digits. Examples: "2014-10-02T15:01:23Z" and "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.UpdateTime
member.summary: Output only. The timestamp of when the File was last updated. A timestamp in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, with nanosecond resolution and up to nine fractional digits. Examples: "2014-10-02T15:01:23Z" and "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.ExpirationTime
member.summary: Output only. The timestamp of when the File will be deleted. Only set if the File is scheduled to expire. A timestamp in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, with nanosecond resolution and up to nine fractional digits. Examples: "2014-10-02T15:01:23Z" and "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.Sha256Hash
member.summary: Output only. SHA-256 hash of the uploaded bytes. A base64-encoded string.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResource.Uri
member.summary: Output only. The uri of the File.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ListFilesResponse
member.summary: Response from ListFiles method containing a paginated list of Files.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ListFilesResponse.Files
member.summary: The list of Files.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ListFilesResponse.NextPageToken
member.summary: A token, which can be sent as pageToken to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no more pages.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FileResponse
member.summary: A file uploaded to the API.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCall
member.summary: A predicted FunctionCall returned from the model that contains a string representing the FunctionDeclaration.name with the parameters and their values.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCall.Name
member.summary: Required. The name of the function to call. Matches [FunctionDeclaration.name].

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCall.Args
member.summary: Optional. The function parameters and values in JSON object format. See [FunctionDeclaration.parameters] for parameter details.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCallingConfig
member.summary: Configuration for specifying function calling behavior.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCallingConfig.Mode
member.summary: Optional. Specifies the mode in which function calling should execute. If unspecified, the default value will be set to AUTO.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionCallingConfig.AllowedFunctionNames
member.summary: Optional. A set of function names that, when provided, limits the functions the model will call. This should only be set when the Mode is ANY. Function names should match [FunctionDeclaration.name]. With mode set to ANY, model will predict a function call from the set of function names provided.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionDeclaration
member.summary: Structured representation of a function declaration as defined by the OpenAPI 3.03 specification. Included in this declaration are the function name and parameters. This FunctionDeclaration is a representation of a block of code that can be used as a Tool by the model and executed by the client.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionDeclaration.Name
member.summary: Required. The name of the function to call. Must start with a letter or an underscore. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 63.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionDeclaration.Description
member.summary: Required. A brief description of the function. Description and purpose of the function. Model uses it to decide how and whether to call the function.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionDeclaration.Parameters
member.summary: Optional. Describes the parameters to this function. Reflects the Open API 3.03 Parameter Object string Key: the name of the parameter. Parameter names are case sensitive. Schema Value: the Schema defining the type used for the parameter. For function with no parameters, this can be left unset. Example with 1 required and 1 optional parameter: type: OBJECT properties: param1: type: STRING param2: type: INTEGER required: -

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionResponse
member.summary: The result output of a FunctionCall that contains a string representing the FunctionDeclaration.name and a structured JSON object containing any output from the function call. It is used as context to the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionResponse.Name
member.summary: Required. The name of the function to call. Matches [FunctionDeclaration.name] and [FunctionCall.name].

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.FunctionResponse.Response
member.summary: Required. The function response in JSON object format.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest
member.summary: Request to generate a grounded answer from the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.Contents
member.summary: Required. The content of the current conversation with the model. For single-turn queries, this is a single question to answer. For multi-turn queries, this is a repeated field that contains conversation history and the last Content in the list containing the question. Note: models.generateAnswer currently only supports queries in English.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.AnswerStyle
member.summary: Required. Style in which answers should be returned.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.SafetySettings
member.summary: Optional. A list of unique SafetySetting instances for blocking unsafe content. This will be enforced on the GenerateAnswerRequest.Contents and GenerateAnswerResponse.candidate. There should not be more than one setting for each SafetyCategory type. The API will block any contents and responses that fail to meet the thresholds set by these settings. This list overrides the default settings for each SafetyCategory specified in the safetySettings. If there is no SafetySetting for a given SafetyCategory provided in the list, the API will use the default safety setting for that category. Harm categories HARM_CATEGORY_HATE_SPEECH, HARM_CATEGORY_SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT, HARM_CATEGORY_DANGEROUS_CONTENT, HARM_CATEGORY_HARASSMENT are supported.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.InlinePassages
member.summary: Passages provided inline with the request.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.SemanticRetriever
member.summary: Content retrieved from resources created via the Semantic Retriever API.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.Temperature
member.summary: Optional. Controls the randomness of the output. Values can range from [0.0,1.0], inclusive. A value closer to 1.0 will produce responses that are more varied and creative, while a value closer to 0.0 will typically result in more straightforward responses from the model. A low temperature (~0.2) is usually recommended for Attributed-Question-Answering use cases.

member.name: M:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Required. Name of the resource for retrieval, e.g. corpora/123 or corpora/123/documents/abc.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SemanticRetrieverConfig.Query
member.summary: Required. Query to use for similarity matching Chunks in the given resource.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SemanticRetrieverConfig.MetadataFilters
member.summary: Optional. Filters for selecting Documents and/or Chunks from the resource.

member.summary: Optional. Maximum number of relevant Chunks to retrieve.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SemanticRetrieverConfig.MinimumRelevanceScore
member.summary: Optional. Minimum relevance score for retrieved relevant Chunks.

member.summary: List of passages.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerResponse
member.summary: Response from the model for a grounded answer.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerResponse.Text
member.summary: Responded text information of first candidate.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerResponse.Answer
member.summary: Candidate answer from the model. Note: The model always attempts to provide a grounded answer, even when the answer is unlikely to be answerable from the given passages. In that case, a low-quality or ungrounded answer may be provided, along with a low answerableProbability.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerResponse.AnswerableProbability
member.summary: Output only. The model's estimate of the probability that its answer is correct and grounded in the input passages. A low answerableProbability indicates that the answer might not be grounded in the sources.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateAnswerResponse.InputFeedback
member.summary: Output only. Feedback related to the input data used to answer the question, as opposed to model-generated response to the question.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest
member.summary: Request to generate a completion from the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest.Contents
member.summary: Required. The content of the current conversation with the model. For single-turn queries, this is a single instance. For multi-turn queries, this is a repeated field that contains conversation history + latest request.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest.GenerationConfig
member.summary: Optional. Configuration options for model generation and outputs.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest.SafetySettings
member.summary: Optional. A list of unique SafetySetting instances for blocking unsafe content. This will be enforced on the GenerateContentRequest.contents and GenerateContentResponse.candidates. There should not be more than one setting for each SafetyCategory type. The API will block any contents and responses that fail to meet the thresholds set by these settings. This list overrides the default settings for each SafetyCategory specified in the safetySettings. If there is no SafetySetting for a given SafetyCategory provided in the list, the API will use the default safety setting for that category. Harm categories HARM_CATEGORY_HATE_SPEECH, HARM_CATEGORY_SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT, HARM_CATEGORY_DANGEROUS_CONTENT, HARM_CATEGORY_HARASSMENT are supported.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest.Tools
member.summary: Optional. A list of Tools the model may use to generate the next response. A Tool is a piece of code that enables the system to interact with external systems to perform an action, or set of actions, outside of knowledge and scope of the model. The only supported tool is currently Function.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest.SystemInstruction
member.summary: Optional. Available for gemini-1.5-pro and gemini-1.0-pro-002. Instructions for the model to steer it toward better performance. For example, "Answer as concisely as possible" or "Don't use technical terms in your response". The text strings count toward the token limit. The role field of systemInstruction is ignored and doesn't affect the performance of the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateContentRequest.ToolConfig

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest
member.summary: Generates a response from the model given an input MessagePrompt.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest.Prompt
member.summary: Required. The free-form input text given to the model as a prompt. Given a prompt, the model will generate a TextCompletion response it predicts as the completion of the input text.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest.Temperature
member.summary: Optional. Controls the randomness of predictions. Temperature controls the degree of randomness in token selection. Lower temperatures are good for prompts that expect a true or correct response, while higher temperatures can lead to more diverse or unexpected results. With a temperature of 0, the highest probability token is always selected.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest.TopP
member.summary: Optional. If specified, nucleus sampling will be used. Top-p changes how the model selects tokens for output. Tokens are selected from most probable to least until the sum of their probabilities equals the top-p value. For example, if tokens A, B and C have a probability of .3, .2 and .1 and the top-p value is .5, then the model will select either A or B as the next token (using temperature).

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest.TopK
member.summary: Optional. If specified, top-k sampling will be used. Top-k changes how the model selects tokens for output. A top-k of 1 means that the selected token is the most probable among all tokens in the model's vocabulary (also called greedy decoding), while a top-k of 3 means that the next token is selected from among the three most probable tokens (using temperature).

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest.CandidateCount
member.summary: Optional. Number of generated responses to return. This value must be between [1, 8], inclusive. If unset, this will default to 1.

member.name: M:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageResponse.Text
member.summary: Responded text information of first candidate.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageResponse.Candidates
member.summary: Candidate response messages from the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageResponse.Messages
member.summary: The conversation history used by the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateMessageResponse.Filters
member.summary: A set of content filtering metadata for the prompt and response text. This indicates which SafetyCategory(s) blocked a candidate from this response, the lowest HarmProbability that triggered a block, and the HarmThreshold setting for that category. This indicates the smallest change to the SafetySettings that would be necessary to unblock at least 1 response.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateTextRequest.Prompt

This list overrides the default settings for each SafetyCategory specified in the safetySettings. member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateTextRequest.MaxOutputTokens
member.summary: Optional. The maximum number of output tokens to generate per message. Token limit determines the maximum amount of text output from one prompt. A token is approximately four characters.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerateTextRequest.StopSequences
member.summary: Optional. Stop sequences. A stop sequence is a series of characters (including spaces) that stops response generation if the model encounters it. The sequence is not included as part of the response. You can add up to five stop sequences.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerationConfig.TopK
member.summary: Optional. If specified, top-k sampling will be used. Top-k changes how the model selects tokens for output. A top-k of 1 means that the selected token is the most probable among all tokens in the model's vocabulary (also called greedy decoding), while a top-k of 3 means that the next token is selected from among the three most probable tokens (using temperature).

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerationConfig.CandidateCount
member.summary: Optional. Number of generated responses to return. This value must be between [1, 8], inclusive. If unset, this will default to 1.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerationConfig.MaxOutputTokens
member.summary: Optional. The maximum number of output tokens to generate per message. Token limit determines the maximum amount of text output from one prompt. A token is approximately four characters.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerationConfig.StopSequences
member.summary: Optional. Stop sequences. A stop sequence is a series of characters (including spaces) that stops response generation if the model encounters it. The sequence is not included as part of the response. You can add up to five stop sequences.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GenerationConfig.ResponseMimeType
member.summary: Optional. Output response mimetype of the generated candidate text. Supported mimetype: `text/plain`: (default) Text output. `application/json`: JSON response in the candidates.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GoogleSearchRetrieval
member.summary: Tool to retrieve public web data for grounding, powered by Google.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GoogleSearchRetrieval.DisableAttribution
member.summary: Optional. Disable using the result from this tool in detecting grounding attribution.
member.remarks: This does not affect how the result is given to the model for generation.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GroundingAttributionSegment.StartIndex
member.summary: Output only. Start index into the content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GroundingAttributionSegment.EndIndex
member.summary: Output only. End index into the content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.GroundingAttributionSegment.PartIndex
member.summary: Output only. Part index into the content.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.HyperParameters
member.summary: Hyperparameters controlling the tuning process. Read more at https://ai.google.dev/docs/model_tuning_guidance

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.HyperParameters.BatchSize
member.summary: Immutable. The batch size hyperparameter for tuning. If not set, a default of 4 or 16 will be used based on the number of training examples.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.HyperParameters.LearningRate
member.summary: Optional. Immutable. The learning rate hyperparameter for tuning. If not set, a default of 0.001 or 0.0002 will be calculated based on the number of training examples.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.HyperParameters.LearningRateMultiplier
member.summary: Optional. Immutable. The learning rate multiplier is used to calculate a final learningRate based on the default (recommended) value. Actual learning rate := learningRateMultiplier * default learning rate Default learning rate is dependent on base model and dataset size. If not set, a default of 1.0 will be used.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.HyperParameters.EpochCount
member.summary: Immutable. The number of training epochs. An epoch is one pass through the training data. If not set, a default of 5 will be used.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.InlineData
member.summary: Raw media bytes sent directly in the request. Text should not be sent as raw bytes.
member.remarks: Serialized bytes data of the image or video. You can specify at most 1 image with inlineData. To specify up to 16 images, use fileData.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.InlineData.Data
member.summary: The base64 encoding of the image, PDF, or video to include inline in the prompt.
member.remarks: When including media inline, you must also specify MIMETYPE. Size limit: 20MB

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.InlineData.MimeType
member.summary: The IANA standard MIME type of the source data.
member.remarks: The media type of the image, PDF, or video specified in the data or fileUri fields. Acceptable values include the following: "image/png", "image/jpeg", "image/heic", "image/heif", "image/webp". application/pdf video/mov video/mpeg video/mp4 video/mpg video/avi video/wmv video/mpegps video/flv Maximum video length: 2 minutes. No limit on image resolution.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Message
member.summary: The base unit of structured text. A Message includes an author and the content of the Message. The author is used to tag messages when they are fed to the model as text.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Message.Author
member.summary: Optional. The author of this Message. This serves as a key for tagging the content of this Message when it is fed to the model as text. The author can be any alphanumeric string.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Message.Content
member.summary: Required. The text content of the structured Message.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Message.CitationMetadata
member.summary: Output only. Citation information for model-generated content in this Message. If this Message was generated as output from the model, this field may be populated with attribution information for any text included in the content. This field is used only on output.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MessagePrompt
member.summary: All of the structured input text passed to the model as a prompt. A MessagePrompt contains a structured set of fields that provide context for the conversation, examples of user input/model output message pairs that prime the model to respond in different ways, and the conversation history or list of messages representing the alternating turns of the conversation between the user and the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MessagePrompt.Context
member.summary: Optional. Text that should be provided to the model first to ground the response. If not empty, this context will be given to the model first before the examples and messages. When using a context be sure to provide it with every request to maintain continuity.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MessagePrompt.Examples
member.summary: Optional. Examples of what the model should generate. This includes both user input and the response that the model should emulate.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MessagePrompt.Messages
member.summary: Required. A snapshot of the recent conversation history sorted chronologically. Turns alternate between two authors.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MetadataFilter
member.summary: User provided filter to limit retrieval based on Chunk or Document level metadata values. Example (genre = drama OR genre = action): key = "document.custom_metadata.genre" conditions = [{stringValue = "drama", operation = EQUAL}, {stringValue = "action", operation = EQUAL}]

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MetadataFilter.Key
member.summary: Required. The key of the metadata to filter on.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MetadataFilter.Conditions
member.summary: Required. The Conditions for the given key that will trigger this filter. Multiple Conditions are joined by logical ORs.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Condition
member.summary: Filter condition applicable to a single key.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Condition.Operation
member.summary: Required. Operator applied to the given key-value pair to trigger the condition.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Condition.StringValue
member.summary: The string value to filter the metadata on.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Condition.NumericValue
member.summary: The numeric value to filter the metadata on.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ListModelsResponse
member.summary: Response from ListModels method containing a paginated list of Models.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ListModelsResponse.Models
member.summary: The list of Models.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ListModelsResponse.NextPageToken
member.summary: A token, which can be sent as pageToken to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no more pages.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse
member.summary: Information about a Generative Language Model. Ref: https://ai.google.dev/api/rest/v1beta/models

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.Name
member.summary: Required. The resource name of the Model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.BaseModelId
member.summary: The name of the base model, pass this to the generation request.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.Version
member.summary: The version number of the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.DisplayName
member.summary: The human-readable name of the model. E.g. "Chat Bison". The name can be up to 128 characters long and can consist of any UTF-8 characters.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.Description
member.summary: A short description of the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.InputTokenLimit
member.summary: Maximum number of input tokens allowed for this model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.OutputTokenLimit
member.summary: Maximum number of output tokens available for this model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.SupportedGenerationMethods
member.summary: The model's supported generation methods. The method names are defined as Pascal case strings, such as generateMessage which correspond to API methods.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.Temperature
member.summary: Controls the randomness of the output. Values can range over [0.0,1.0], inclusive. A value closer to 1.0 will produce responses that are more varied, while a value closer to 0.0 will typically result in less surprising responses from the model. This value specifies default to be used by the backend while making the call to the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.TopP
member.summary: For Nucleus sampling. Nucleus sampling considers the smallest set of tokens whose probability sum is at least topP. This value specifies default to be used by the backend while making the call to the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.TopK
member.summary: For Top-k sampling. Top-k sampling considers the set of topK most probable tokens. This value specifies default to be used by the backend while making the call to the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.State
member.summary: Output only. The state of the tuned model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.CreateTime
member.summary: Output only. The timestamp when this model was created. A timestamp in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, with nanosecond resolution and up to nine fractional digits. Examples: "2014-10-02T15:01:23Z" and "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.UpdateTime
member.summary: Output only. The timestamp when this model was updated. A timestamp in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, with nanosecond resolution and up to nine fractional digits. Examples: "2014-10-02T15:01:23Z" and "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.TuningTask
member.summary: Required. The tuning task that creates the tuned model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.TunedModelSource
member.summary: Optional. TunedModel to use as the starting point for training the new model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ModelResponse.BaseModel
member.summary: The name of the base model, pass this to the generation request.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TunedModelSource
member.summary: Tuned model as a source for training a new model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TunedModelSource.TunedModel
member.summary: Immutable. The name of the TunedModel to use as the starting point for training the new model. Example: tunedModels/my-tuned-model

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TunedModelSource.BaseModel
member.summary: Output only. The name of the base Model this TunedModel was tuned from. Example: models/text-bison-001

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part
member.summary: A datatype containing media that is part of a multi-part Content message. A part of a turn in a conversation with the model with a fixed MIME type. It has one of the following mutually exclusive fields: 1. text 2. inline_data 3. file_data 4. functionResponse 5. functionCall

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part.Text
member.summary: A text part of a conversation with the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part.InlineData
member.summary: Raw media bytes sent directly in the request.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part.FileData
member.summary: URI based data.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part.FunctionResponse
member.summary: The result output of a FunctionCall that contains a string representing the FunctionDeclaration.name and a structured JSON object containing any output from the function is used as context to the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part.FunctionCall
member.summary: A predicted FunctionCall returned from the model that contains a string representing the FunctionDeclaration.name with the arguments and their values.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Part.VideoMetadata
member.summary: Optional. For video input, the start and end offset of the video in Duration format.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.PromptFeedback
member.summary: A set of the feedback metadata the prompt specified in GenerateContentRequest.content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.PromptFeedback.BlockReason
member.summary: Output only. Optional. If set, the prompt was blocked and no candidates are returned. Rephrase your prompt.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.PromptFeedback.SafetyRatings
member.summary: Output only. Ratings for safety of the prompt. There is at most one rating per category.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.PromptFeedback.BlockReasonMessage
member.summary: Output only. A readable block reason message.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Retrieval
member.summary: Defines a retrieval tool that model can call to access external knowledge.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Retrieval.DisableAttribution
member.summary: Optional. Disable using the result from this tool in detecting grounding attribution.
member.remarks: This does not affect how the result is given to the model for generation.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Retrieval.VertexAiSearch
member.summary: Optional. Set to use data source powered by Vertex AI Search.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyFeedback
member.summary: Safety feedback for an entire request. This field is populated if content in the input and/or response is blocked due to safety settings. SafetyFeedback may not exist for every HarmCategory. Each SafetyFeedback will return the safety settings used by the request as well as the lowest HarmProbability that should be allowed in order to return a result.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyFeedback.Rating
member.summary: Safety rating evaluated from content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyFeedback.Setting
member.summary: Safety settings applied to the request.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating
member.summary: Safety rating for a piece of content. Ref: https://ai.google.dev/api/rest/v1beta/SafetyRating

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating.Category
member.summary: Output only. Required. The category for this rating.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating.Probability
member.summary: Output only. Required. The probability of harm for this content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating.ProbabilityScore
member.summary: Output only. Harm probability scoring in the content. Vertex AI only

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating.Severity
member.summary: Output only. Harm severity levels in the content. Vertex AI only

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating.SeverityScore
member.summary: Output only. Harm severity scoring in the content. Vertex AI only

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetyRating.Blocked
member.summary: Output only. Indicates whether the content was filtered out because of this rating. Vertex AI only

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetySetting
member.summary: Safety setting, affecting the safety-blocking behavior. Represents a safety setting that can be used to control the model's behavior. It instructs the model to avoid certain responses given safety measurements based on category. Ref: https://ai.google.dev/api/rest/v1beta/SafetySetting

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetySetting.Category
member.summary: Required. The category for this setting.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.SafetySetting.Threshold
member.summary: Required. Controls the probability threshold at which harm is blocked.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema
member.summary: The Schema object allows the definition of input and output data types. These types can be objects, but also primitives and arrays. Represents a select subset of an OpenAPI 3.0 schema object.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Type
member.summary: Required. Data type.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Format
member.summary: Optional. The format of the data. Supported formats: for NUMBER type: float, double for INTEGER type: int32, int64

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Description
member.summary: Optional. A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use. Parameter description may be formatted as Markdown.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Nullable
member.summary: Optional. Indicates if the value may be null.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Items
member.summary: Optional. Schema of the elements of Type.ARRAY.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Enum
P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Properties
member.summary: Optional. Properties of Type.OBJECT. An object containing a list of "key": value pairs. Example: { "name": "wrench", "mass": "1.3kg", "count": "3" }.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Schema.Required
member.summary: Optional. Required properties of Type.OBJECT.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TextCompletion

member.summary: Output only. The generated text returned from the model.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TextCompletion.SafetyRatings
member.summary: Ratings for the safety of a response. There is at most one rating per category.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TextCompletion.CitationMetadata
member.summary: Output only. Citation information for model-generated output in this TextCompletion. This field may be populated with attribution information for any text included in the output.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.AbstractText.Text
member.summary: Required. The prompt text.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Tool
member.summary: Defines a tool that model can call to access external knowledge.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Tool.FunctionDeclarations
member.summary: Optional. One or more function declarations to be passed to the model along with the current user query. Model may decide to call a subset of these functions by populating [FunctionCall][content.part.function_call] in the response. User should provide a [FunctionResponse][content.part.function_response] for each function call in the next turn. Based on the function responses, Model will generate the final response back to the user. Maximum 64 function declarations can be provided.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Tool.Retrieval
member.summary: Optional. Retrieval tool type. System will always execute the provided retrieval tool(s) to get external knowledge to answer the prompt. Retrieval results are presented to the model for generation.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Tool.GoogleSearchRetrieval
member.summary: Optional. GoogleSearchRetrieval tool type. Specialized retrieval tool that is powered by Google search.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.TuningTask.CompleteTime

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EditConfig
member.summary: Edit config object for model versions 006 and greater. All editConfig subfields are optional. If not specified, the default editing mode is inpainting.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EditConfig.EditMode
member.summary: Optional. Describes the editing mode for the request. One editing mode per request.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EditConfig.GuidanceScale
member.summary: Optional. Controls how much the model adheres to the text prompt. Large values increase output and prompt alignment, but may compromise image quality.
member.remarks: Values: 0-500 - Default: 60

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EditConfig.MaskMode
member.summary: Optional.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EditConfig.MaskDilation
member.summary: Optional. Determines the dilation percentage of the mask provided.
member.remarks: 0.03 (3%) is the default value of shortest side. Minimum: 0, Maximum: 1

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.EditConfig.ProductPosition
member.summary: Optional. Defines whether the detected product should stay fixed or be repositioned. If you set this field, you must also set "editMode": "product-image".
member.remarks: Values: reposition - Lets the model move the location of the detected product or object. (default value) fixed - The model maintains the original positioning of the detected product or object If the input image is not square, the model defaults to reposition.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Image.BytesBase64Encoded
member.summary: A base64 encoded string of one (generated) image. (20 MB)

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Image.MimeType
member.summary: The IANA standard MIME type of the image.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.Image.GcsUri
member.summary: Exists if storageUri is provided. The Cloud Storage uri where the generated images are stored.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.SampleCount
member.summary: The number of generated images.
member.remarks: Accepted integer values: 1-8 (v.002), 1-4 (v.005, v.006). Default value: 4.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.StorageUri
member.summary: Optional. Cloud Storage uri where to store the generated images.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.Seed
member.summary: Optional. Pseudo random seed for reproducible generated outcome; setting the seed lets you generate deterministic output.
member.remarks: Version 006 model only: To use the seed field you must also set "addWatermark": false in the list of parameters.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.Language
member.summary: Optional. The text prompt for guiding the response.
member.remarks: en (default), de, fr, it, es

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.NegativePrompt
member.summary: Optional. Prompt strings that force something not to be generated.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.GuidanceScale
member.summary: Optional. For model version 006 and greater use editConfig.guidanceScale. Controls how much the model adheres to the text prompt. Large values increase output and prompt alignment, but may compromise image quality.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.DisablePersonFace
member.summary: Optional. Whether to disable the person/face safety filter (so that person/face can be included in the generated images).
member.remarks: Deprecated (v.006 only): Use personGeneration instead.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.Mode
member.summary: Optional. With input prompt, image, mask - backgroundEditing mode enables background editing.
member.remarks: Values: backgroundEditing upscale

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.SampleImageSize
member.summary: Optional. Sample image size when mode is set to upscale. This field is no longer required when upscaling. Use upscaleConfig.upscaleFactor to set the upscaled image size.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.AspectRatio
member.summary: Optional. The aspect ratio of the generated image.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.IncludeRaiReason
member.summary: Optional. Whether to enable the Responsible AI filtered reason or error code for blocked output in the response content.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.PersonGeneration
member.summary: Optional. The safety setting that controls the type of people or face generation allowed.
member.remarks: "personGeneration": "allow_all" is not available in Imagen 2 Editing and is only available to approved users in Imagen 2 Generation. Values: allow_all: Allow generation of people of all ages. allow_adult (default): Allow generation of adults only. dont_allow: Disables the inclusion of people or faces in images.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.SafetySetting
member.summary: Optional. The safety setting that controls safety filter thresholds.
member.remarks: Values: block_most: The highest threshold resulting in most requests blocked. block_some (default): The medium threshold that balances blocks for potentially harmful and benign content. block_few: Reduces the number of requests blocked due to safety filters. This setting might increase objectionable content generated by Imagen.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.AddWatermark
member.summary: Defines whether the image will include a SynthID. For more information, see Identifying AI-generated content with SynthID.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.ImageGenerationParameters.EditConfig
member.summary: edit config object for model versions 006 and greater. All editConfig subfields are optional. If not specified, the default editing mode is inpainting.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MaskMode.MaskType
member.summary: Optional. Prompts the model to generate a mask instead of you needing to provide one. Consequently, when you provide this parameter you can omit a mask object.
member.remarks: Values: background: Automatically generates a mask to all regions except primary object, person, or subject in the image foreground: Automatically generates a mask to the primary object, person, or subject in the image semantic: Use automatic segmentation to create a mask area for one or more of the segmentation classes. Set the segmentation classes using the classes parameter and the corresponding class_id values. You can specify up to 5 classes.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.MaskMode.Classes
member.summary: Optional. Determines the classes of objects that will be segmented in an automatically generated mask image. If you use this field, you must also set "maskType": "semantic". See Segmentation class IDs

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.OutputOptions.MimeType
member.summary: Optional. The IANA standard MIME type of the image.
member.remarks: Values: image/jpeg image/png

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.OutputOptions.CompressionQuality
member.summary: Optional. The compression quality of the output image if encoding in image/jpeg.

member.name: P:Mscc.GenerativeAI.UpscaleConfig.UpscaleFactor
member.summary: Optional. When upscaling, the factor to which the image will be upscaled. If not specified, the upscale factor will be determined from the longer side of the input image and sampleImageSize.

member.name: T:Mscc.GenerativeAI.VertexAI
member.summary: Entry point to access Gemini API running in Vertex AI.
member.remarks: See Model reference. See also https://cloud.google.com/nodejs/docs/reference/vertexai/latest/vertexai/vertexinit

member.name: M:Mscc.GenerativeAI.VertexAI.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with access to Vertex AI Gemini API. The default constructor attempts to read .env file and environment variables. Sets default values, if available.
member.remarks:
The following environment variables are used:
GOOGLE_PROJECT_ID Identifier of the Google Cloud project.
GOOGLE_REGION Identifier of the Google Cloud region to use (default: "us-central1").
